alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 8:02PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Chama Above Abiquiu affecting Rio Arriba County. Rio Grande Near San Ildefonso Pueblo affecting Los Alamos and Santa Fe Counties. Rio Grande At Rio Grande at Embudo affecting Rio Arriba, Los Alamos and Santa Fe Counties. Embudo Creek Below Dixon affecting Rio Arriba County. .Warm temperatures have melted snowpack and increased river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Embudo Creek below Dixon. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Access to riverside picnic facilities above Pilar but below the Taos Junction bridge unavailable. Water about to flow over the center section of the low swinging bridge upstream used by local residents who live on the west side of the river. At 12.0 feet, the patio of the Embudo Station building on the west bank begins to flood. The few homes along the river near the restaurant and upstream are in danger of becoming flooded if further rises occur. The suspended wooden bridge over the Rio Grande between Embudo and Pilar linking homes on the west bank with State Highway 68 is closed as water is flowing over the center section of the bridge. Water covers part of the state road 570 between Pilar and the Taos Junction Bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM MDT Sunday the stage was 11.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.9 feet tomorrow evening. - Action stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. To report flooding, contact your local law enforcement agency and your National Weather Service office when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Monday morning around 1030 AM MDT.
